event.title: is thought to have been William S. Gamel in 1846

data.event: The first settler is thought to have been William S. Gamel in 1846.

event.title: a front-line defense against Kiowa, Lipan Apache and Comanche, on July 6, 1851

data.event: The settlement of Mason grew up around Fort Mason which was established by the United States War Department as a front-line defense against Kiowa, Lipan Apache and Comanche, on July 6, 1851.

event.title: established a Fort Mason post office March 8, 1858

data.event: George W. Todd established a Fort Mason post office March 8, 1858, which became consigned to the civilian settlement on June 26, 1858.

event.title: consigned to the civilian settlement on June 26, 1858

data.event: George W. Todd established a Fort Mason post office March 8, 1858, which became consigned to the civilian settlement on June 26, 1858.
In 1860, James E. Ranck opened a second store and later became known as "The Father of Mason".

event.title: was elected the county seat in 1861

data.event: Mason was elected the county seat in 1861 After the U.S. Civil War, returning Confederate veterans and German ranchers clashed in 1875 over cattle rustling and other crimes.
Mason was elected the county seat in 1861 After the U.S. Civil War, returning Confederate veterans and German ranchers clashed in 1875 over cattle rustling and other crimes.
